body_html:
Attempted to build TF on Archlinux as well, with the same problem …
some additional info: The 2to3 linked/created by bazel seems to be only an empty stub:

> cat bazel-out/host/bin/external/bazel_tools/tools/python/2to3
#!/bin/bash

exit 1

I'm totally new to bazel, so I didn't easily spot what went wrong, but someone familiar with it might know what's going on …
Archlinux differs from many distributions, in that python points to python3, not python2; I however tried to pass /usr/bin/python3 to ./configure, without any change in the error …

As a workaround, I changed exit 1 to exec 2to3 $@ [and changed the mtime of the file (soft-link target!) to the future, as bazel apparently checks if the build tools have been tampered with), and could successfully build TF.

Regards, Christian

body:
Attempted to build TF on Archlinux as well, with the same problem …
some additional info: The 2to3 linked/created by bazel seems to be only an empty stub:

```
> cat bazel-out/host/bin/external/bazel_tools/tools/python/2to3
#!/bin/bash

exit 1
```

I'm totally new to bazel, so I didn't easily spot what went wrong, but someone familiar with it might know what's going on …
Archlinux differs from many distributions, in that python points to python3, not python2; I however tried to pass /usr/bin/python3 to `./configure`, without any change in the error …

As a workaround, I changed `exit 1` to `exec 2to3 $@` [and changed the mtime of the file (soft-link target!) to the future, as bazel apparently checks if the build tools have been tampered with), and could successfully build TF.

Regards, Christian
